column1:
SCM004: Does your company have a Patch Management Policy or Procedure?

If yes, please attach.
Artifact Required: Patch Management Policy

Design Elements:
1. Defined organizational patch management schedule and risk based prioritization/categorization (e.g., implementation timeframe associated with each priority)
2. Requirements for interaction with security vulnerability process
3. Requirements for interaction with Incident and infosec incident process, if separate
4. Requirements for patch testing process before going into production
5. Requirements to include rollback abilities for all patches and updates
6. Requirements for the prioritization of patch deployments according to vulnerability risk

SCM005: Does your company have controls (e.g., as an enterprise solution for patch management and deployment) to keep all your IT assets up-to-date with latest security patches including applying and verifying all available high or critical risk security patches at least monthly? 

If yes, please describe the tools used within your environment and if patch management follows standard change management process.
Artifact Required: Log capturing patch updates(coverage of server and work station)
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have controls (e.g., as an enterprise solution for patch management and deployment) to keep all its IT assets up-to-date with latest security patches including applying and verifying all available high or critical risk security patches at least monthly in place.

Integral patch management follows the standard change management process. Patches are applied manually within the Integral environment. 

Integral was able to provide a redacted event log capturing patch updates. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manger on 07/23/2021 and observation of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Event Log - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.
